dockerizing

Dockerizing Ruby Application

FROM ruby:2.5.1-alpine
ADD Gemfile /app/
ADD Gemfile.lock /app/
RUN apk --update add --virtual build-dependencies ruby-dev build-base && \
    gem install bundler --no-ri --no-rdoc && \
    cd /app ; bundle install --without development test && \
    apk del build-dependencies
ADD . /app
RUN chown -R nobody:nogroup /app
USER nobody
ENV RACK_ENV production
EXPOSE 9292
WORKDIR /app

IDE Support

VSCode

https://medium.com/better-programming/code-like-a-pro-tooling-to-supercharge-vs-code-for-ruby-bf2ae61df5e3

  1. Install vscode extensions:

    • Ruby: rebornix.ruby
    • Ruby Language Colorization: groksrc.ruby
    • Ruby Solargraph: castwide.solargraph
    • VSCode Ruby: wingrunr21.vscode-ruby - this comes with another plugin as a dependency

  2. Install two global gems. These are used by the IDE and have trouble using project level rvn installs.

    rvm @global do bundle update
rvm @global do gem install rubocop
rvm @global do gem install solargraph

  3. Configure VSCode User Settings:

    "ruby.codeCompletion": "rcodetools",
"ruby.format": "rubocop",
"ruby.intellisense": "rubyLocate",
"ruby.useBundler": true, //run non-lint commands with bundle exec
"ruby.useLanguageServer": true, // use the internal language server (see below)
"ruby.lint": {
    "rubocop": {
    "useBundler": true // enable rubocop via bundler
    },
    "reek": {
    "useBundler": true // enable reek via bundler
    }
}

  4. Restart IDE

https://medium.com/@kirill_shevch/lint-your-ruby-code-with-overcommit-and-static-analysis-tools-bd36d3147d2e

  1. Add these gems to your project.

        gem 'debase', '~> 0.2.1', group: :development
    gem 'overcommit', '~> 0.54.0'
    gem 'rubocop', require: false

    Run

    bundle install

  2. Configure IDE

  3. Setup overcommit

    overcommit --install
overcommit --sign

  4. Setup rubocop

    rubocop --auto-gen-config
rubocop -a -x

  5. Edit overcommit config, enable rubocop

    PreCommit:
  RuboCop:
    enabled: true

  6. Hooks will now run on commits
